newsitem.title: USA: Corrections to build Florida jail annex.
newsitem.headline: Corrections to build Florida jail annex.

text.p: Corrections Corp. of America said Wednesday it will invest about $31 million to design, build and operate a 1000-bed jail annex in Lakeland, Fla.
The five-year contract was approved by Polk County commissioners Tuesday and is expected to produce over $16 million in annual revenues for the Nashville, Tenn.-based company.
The all-cell facility is scheduled to open in the fourth quarter of 1997.
Corrections Corp. manages prisons and other correctional institutions for government agencies.
Its stock fell 12.5 cents to $32.25 on the New York Stock Exchange in late morning trading.
